Unusual activity originating from source.Data: Windows Event ID 4624; Windows Event ID 4688; Zeek conn.log
Unusual activity originating from source.Action: Filter Zeek conn.log and Windows Event ID 4624 (successful logins) / 4688 (process creation) by source IP ranges or user accounts known to belong to third-party vendors. Analyze activity patterns (e.g., data volume, connection frequency, types of processes launched) using descriptive statistics and time series analysis to identify deviations from established baselines for these trusted entities.

Suspicious access patterns or actions pe.Data: Windows Event ID 4624; Windows Event ID 4688
Suspicious access patterns or actions pe.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4624 (successful logins) and 4688 (process creation) for accounts known to have delegated administrator permissions. Correlate login events with subsequent actions (process creation, file access) using correlation analysis. Identify accounts showing logins from unusual locations (using geolocation and frequency analysis) or performing actions outside their typical scope or hours (using time series analysis and descriptive statistics).

Logins using trusted third-party account.Data: Windows Event ID 4624; Windows Event ID 4625; Zeek conn.log
Logins using trusted third-party account.Action: Collect Windows Event ID 4624 (successful logon) and 4625 (failed logon) and Zeek conn.log data for accounts associated with trusted third parties. Extract source IP addresses. Geolocate source IPs. Use frequency analysis and historical data to establish a baseline of expected source IPs, networks, and geographic locations for each trusted account/vendor. Flag login attempts and successful logons originating from IPs/locations significantly deviating from the baseline (e.g., using percentile analysis or outlier detection methods).

Trusted third-party accounts accessing i.Data: Zeek conn.log; Windows Event ID 4624; Windows Event ID 4688
Trusted third-party accounts accessing i.Action: Using historical Zeek conn.log data (destination IP/port) and Windows Event ID 4624 data (target system), establish a baseline of expected systems and resources accessed by each trusted third-party account. Monitor current logs for access to systems or resources outside this baseline. Use correlation analysis to link Zeek connections and successful logons (4624) by trusted accounts to subsequent process creation (4688) on target systems. Identify anomalies in resource access frequency or type using descriptive statistics and comparison to baseline behavior.
